data.title: Who is in the cast of Ghostbusters: Afterlife?
data.meta_description: THE Ghostbusters franchise continues to grow with Ghostbusters: Afterlife.This will be the franchise's fourth movie since the original debuted back in
data.text:
THE Ghostbusters franchise continues to grow with Ghostbusters: Afterlife.

This will be the franchise's fourth movie since the original debuted back in 1984.

Who is in the cast of Ghostbusters: Afterlife?

The new film will feature an array of familiar faces from the original Ghostbuster movies.

The cast members include:

Finn Wolfhard

Finn Wolfhard, 18, plays the role of Trevor.

Born December 23, 2002, Wolfhard is a Canadian actor who is most famously known for his role as Mike Wheeler in Strangers Things.

Wolfhard has also starred in It, Pinocchio, and The Addams Family.

Mckenna Grace

Mckenna Grace, 15, plays the role of Phoebe.

Born June 25, 2006, Grace has been acting since she was six-years-old when she got her started on Disney XD's Crash & Bernstein and The Young and the Restless.

From 2016-2020, Grace starred on Fuller House and played Young Carol in Marvel's Captain Marvel back in 2019.

She can also be recognized from her role as Young Theo in 2018's The Haunting of Hill House.

Carrie Coon

Carrie Alexandra Coon, 40, plays the role of Callie.

Born January 24, 1981, Coon started acting in 2011 and is most famously known for her roles in Gone Girl, Avengers: Infinity War, The Post, and The Leftovers.

Since 2013, she has been married to actor Tracy Letts and has one child, Haskell.

Paul Rudd

American actor, comedian, screenwriter, and producer Paul Stephen Rudd, 52, plays the role of Mr. Grooberson.

Born April 6, 1969, Rudd started acting in 1992 and is most famously known for his role as Ant Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Outside of his Marvel films, Rudd is known for his roles in I Love You Man and The Perks of Being a Wallflower.

Since 2003, he has been married to Julie Yaeger and has two children, Jack Sullivan and Darby.

Sigourney Weaver

Susan Alexandra "Sigourney" Weaver, 71, is reprising her role as Dana Barrett from the original 1980's films.

Born October 8, 1949, Weaver started acting back in 1970 and is most famously known for her role as Dr. Grace Augustine in the Avatar franchise, and Ripley in the Alien franchise.

Along with starring in the original Ghostbusters and Ghostbusters II, Weaver also starred in the 2016 Ghostbusters movie as Rebecca Gorin.

Since 1984, Weaver has been married to actor and director Jim Simpson and has one daughter, Charlotte.

Bill Murray

William James Murray, 70, is also reprising his role as Dr. Peter Venkman from the original films.

Born September 21, 1950, Murray got his start in acting back in 1973 and is most famously known for his role in the original Ghostbusters movies.

Along with Weaver, Murray also starred in the 2016 Ghostbusters film as Martin Heiss and is known for starring in Groundhog Day, Lost in Translation, and Caddyshack.

Murray is the father to six children and has been married twice throughout his life.

Dan Aykroyd

Daniel Edward Aykroyd, 69, is also reprising his role as Dr. Raymond Stantz.

Born July 1, 1952, Aykroyd started acting in 1974 and is known for his roles in Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, Ghostbusters, and The Campaign.

Along with being a successful actor, Aykroyd is also credited as a writer in over 30 productions.

Along with acting in the films, Aykroyd is also the original writer of all the Ghostbuster films.

Since 1983, he has been married to actress Donna Dixon.

Annie Potts

Anne "Annie" Hampton Potts, 68, is reprising her role as Janie Melnitz.

Born October 28, 1952, Potts got her start in acting back in 1977 and is known for her roles in the Ghostbusters films as well as Pretty in Pink, Jumpin' Jack Flash, Who's Harry Crumb?, Young Sheldon.

Potts is also the voice of Bo Peep in the Toy Story movies.

Potts has been married four times throughout her life and has been married to her current husband, James Hayman, since 1990.

Bokeem Woodbine

Bokeem Woodbine, 48, plays the role of Sheriff Domingo.

Born April 13, 1973, Woodbine got his start in acting back in 1993and is most famously known for his roles in Fargo, Spider-Man: Homecoming, and Queen & Slim.

He is currently married to Mahiely Woodbine.

Ernie Hudson

Earnest "Ernie" Lee Hudson, 75, is also reprising his role as Dr. Winston Zeddmore is the upcoming film.

Born December 17, 1945, Hudson has been acting since 1976 and is also known for his roles in The Family Business and The Crow.

Since 1985, Husdon has been married to Linda Kingsberg.

When is Ghostbusters: Afterlife being released?

The film is expected November 11, 2021.

The film is about a single mother and her two children who move to a new town and discover that they have a connection to the original Ghostbusters and their grandfather's secret legacy.

The film was originally supposed to be released July 2020, but was then delayed until June 2021 and delayed again until November.
